title: Emotet Variant Detected on Endpoint
description: Emotet malware variant detected on endpoint ACME-WS-042. Suspicious PowerShell execution followed by network beaconing to known C2 infrastructure. Immediate isolation recommended to prevent lateral movement.

title: Unauthorized Admin Access from Foreign IP
description: Suspicious administrative login detected from IP 185.234.72.19 (Russia). Account: svc_backup. This service account should only authenticate from internal systems. Possible credential compromise.

title: CVE-2024-21410 Exploitation Attempt
description: Multiple attempts to exploit CVE-2024-21410 (Exchange Server Elevation of Privilege) detected. Attack originated from 103.45.221.88. WAF rules blocked 15/17 attempts.

title: Unusual Data Transfer to Cloud Storage
description: Employee account (agarcia@acme.com) uploaded 4.7 GB to personal Dropbox account during off-hours. Volume is 10x normal baseline. Potential data exfiltration or insider threat.

title: Ransomware Indicators Detected
description: File encryption behavior detected on file server FS-PROD-03. Multiple files renamed with .locked extension. Shadow copies deleted. Immediate response required.

title: SSH Brute Force Attack
description: 5,234 failed SSH login attempts from 89.248.163.12 targeting ACME-WEB-01. Attack pattern matches known botnet behavior. Source IP added to blocklist.

title: Unauthorized Software Installation
description: TeamViewer remote access software installed on ACME-WS-127 without IT approval. Software violates corporate security policy and creates potential backdoor.

title: Phishing Email with Malicious Attachment
description: Phishing email with subject 'Urgent: Invoice Payment Required' delivered to 47 employees. Attachment contains malicious macro. 3 users opened attachment, 0 enabled macros.

title: S3 Bucket Publicly Accessible
description: AWS S3 bucket 'acme-prod-backups' configured with public read access. Bucket contains customer data and should be private. Misconfiguration detected during routine scan.

title: After-Hours Database Access
description: Production database accessed at 3:47 AM by developer account (dbrown@acme.com). Time is outside normal work hours and user is not on-call. Possible compromised account.

title: PCI-DSS Compliance Violation
description: Credit card processing system ACME-PCI-01 has not applied required security patches within 30-day compliance window. System is 12 days overdue for patching.

title: Port Scan Detected
description: Comprehensive port scan detected from IP 45.142.212.35. Scanner probed 1,024 ports on perimeter firewall. No vulnerabilities exposed. Standard internet background noise.

title: SSL Certificate Expiring Soon
description: SSL certificate for api.acme.com expires in 14 days. Renewal process should be initiated to prevent service disruption.

title: Antivirus Definition Out of Date
description: Endpoint ACME-WS-201 has not updated antivirus definitions in 8 days. Device may be offline or experiencing update failures.

title: Multiple Failed Login Attempts
description: User account kjones@acme.com had 12 failed login attempts over 2 hours. User reported forgotten password and successfully reset credentials.
